title: hw3
text:
If your working directory is myfolder/homework/, what relative path would you specify to get the file located at myfolder/MyData.csv?

“../MyData.csv”

What are the major benefits of using R projects?
What is git and what is github?
What are the two main differences between a tibble and a data.frame?
Rewrite the following nested function call using baseR’s chaining operator: arrange(filter(select(as_tibble(iris), starts_with(“Petal”), Species), Petal.Length < 1.55), Species)
What is meant by long format data and wide format data? Which do we generally prefer for statistical analysis?

title: hw3
text:
Task 2 Reading Delimited Data




library(tidyverse)

glass <- read_csv("https://www4.stat.ncsu.edu/~online/datasets/glass.data",
                  col_names = c("Id", "RI", "Na", "Mg", "Al", "Si","K","Ca","Ba","Fe","Type_of_Glass"))

Rows: 214 Columns: 11
── Column specification ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Delimiter: ","
dbl (11): Id, RI, Na, Mg, Al, Si, K, Ca, Ba, Fe, Type_of_Glass

ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message.

# ℹ 204 more rows






glass<- glass %>%
  mutate(Type_of_Glass1 = case_when(
    Type_of_Glass == 1 ~ "building_windows_float_processed",
    Type_of_Glass == 2 ~ "building_windows_non_float_processed",
    Type_of_Glass == 3 ~ "vehicle_windows_float_processed",
    Type_of_Glass == 4 ~ "vehicle_windows_non_float_processed",
    Type_of_Glass == 5 ~ "containers",
    Type_of_Glass == 6 ~ "tableware",
    Type_of_Glass == 7 ~ "headlamps"
  ))

glass

glass_filtered <- glass %>%
  filter(Fe < 0.2 & (Type_of_Glass1 == "tableware" | Type_of_Glass1 == "headlamps"))
glass_filtered
